newsitem.title: UK: U.K. Intervention Board details EU sugar sales.
newsitem.headline: U.K. Intervention Board details EU sugar sales.

text.p: A total 30,350 tonnes of current series white sugar received export rebates of a maximum 42.168 European Currency Units (Ecus) per 100 kilos at Wednesday's European Union (EU) tender, the U.K. Intervention Board said.
Out of this, traders in France received 24,250 tonnes, in Belgium 5,000, in Finland 600 and in Spain 500 tonnes, it added.

This week's award brings the cumulative tonnage awarded for export from the 1996/97 crop to 2.250 million tonnes. This compares with the 67,250 tonnes awarded on June 19, 1996, when the cumulative tonnage totalled 2.388 million tonnes.
Last week the EU awarded 33,600 tonnes of white sugar at its tender when the restitution was 42.295 Ecus.
